reviews.review_msg: Extremely rude and unprofessional. Worst crim prof at sfu

Professor is knowledgeable and nice. Unfortunately the class content itself is very boring... Also, lots of readings to do each week. The class is more science/forensic sided rather than criminology sided. Not a bad class but not a great one either. I would not take another forensics class, but I wouldn't mind taking a class with Dr. Bell again.
Worst CRIM prof ever! She seems well-versed in Forensics but she is very inconsiderate. Paper rubrics and instructions are vague. Unprofessional email ethics.
She is very knowledgeable in her field. Even though her lectures can be boring, she is straightforward in what she wants in exams or papers. Nothing is vague.

do yourself a favor and take a class with dr. bell - she's literally an angel, so caring and understanding - especially about the TA strike this year she was extra lenient and made her lectures accessible. she marks really reasonable and her exams and papers are extremely straightforward. she's just such a sweetheart.

WORST PROF AT SFU SO FAR. Her lectures are terribly boring and her slides are not intuitive at all. Her slides looks like she spent 10 minutes making them and she shows little to no effort on delivering the material. She does not promote students to ask questions and shuts down students when they do ask questions. Do not take a course with her.
Terrible

lectures incredibly boring, seemed like she did not want to be there or teach at all. not open to student questions-had a class dedicated to questions about the final exam and she didn't answer any-talked to students like they were stupid for asking. did not go into detail about course content as we should have been able to figure it out ourselves.
Terrible human being. Rude and inconsiderate. At one point, said that they don't believe in stats.

Dr. Bell definitely has a specific sense of humour that might not be for everyone, however, I really enjoyed this course and the content that was covered. You can also tell that Dr. Bell is very passionate about the work she does. Grades were based on two take home exams, a quiz, and a short news article critique. I recommend her.

I know the reviews on Dr.Bell are not the greatest but trust me when I say - TAKE A SEMINAR CLASS WITH DR. BELL. She is so intelligent, so respected and funny. She shows so many real life examples and gives you real knowledge of Forensics. Plus she brought us cake for our last class. She wants to see you succeed and cares about her students.

The content itself is fairly easy to understand. Criteria for assignments and exams were broad and not very clear, resulting in lots of confusion. Lectures were boring and uninspiring but the readings themselves were surprisingly interesting (if you are interested in the field of forensics however). Exams were take home essays (emphasis on readings

This course was quite simple overall, not too dense or anything and she is very passionate about her field of work, which is great to see. My main criticism is that the criteria for assignments were very broad, and many students didn't do so well because of the lack of clear instruction. Besides that, the course is easy to comprehend!

Lynne was great! Lectures were engaging, and the presentation was actually pretty fun since you picked your own topic! Not having the stress of a final, I feel like I actually learnt more info that will stick with me. She could seem patronizing if you asked too simple a question, but she's just got a different sense of humour you need to understand

Lynne was good, she had interesting and engaging lectures. The expectations for the exams was clear and she gave plenty of advice to help you out as much as she could. I found the course to have a heavy bio focus for a crim course but she taught it well to non-biologists. The topic of the paper was actually really interesting and clear
I don't know if it is just me, but I feel like a most lectures irrelevant to the textbook but all the exams are based on the textbook. WHAT?

Dr. Bell is definitely an anatomical specialist in her own right. I enjoyed very much in the way she delivers the course content. As a scientist herself, suprisingly, she seems to be quite spiritual. We simply need more scientist follow high moral codes like herself.

Very patronizing well when students approach her with questions. Her assignments are easy but her instructions are poorly organized. She displayed discriminatory attitudes toward students from non-science backgrounds yet she is the one in a social science department. She is not equipped to be a lecturer in social science nor health science. Period

Gpa booster. Go to class and take notes aside from her powerpoint slides. Shes great at explaining the topic, even though it could get boring. Midterm was easy marks and only one final, which questions are given a week before. Prep for the final with all her ppt, notes you took in class, readings and you will do well.

I took 2 classes with her - Crim 356 & Crim 452Awesome prof! Assignments are not overly long and she marks easily however the instructions are not overly detailed which can make it difficult. Super interesting lectures. You don't really need to do the readings. Overall I would definitely recommend   taking classes with Dr Bell

Dr. Bell is hilarious and an awesome prof! She's a fair marker, but don't expect to be babied through the course or to try and BS her or your presentation, because she isn't afraid to call you on it. This class is very unusual in nature since there are no exams; attendance not mandatory but go anyways!

1 take home midterm/essay, 1 super easy presentation, 1 critique on an article, and 1 pre-seen final with 3 straight forward essay questions. Can't get any better to be honest. Very different from 355 so lectures might be a little dry at times, but everything's online anyway so attendance isn't mandatory. Her stories are quite interesting.

One paper which you write on any topic related to Forensics. One easy presentation, and a take home test consisting of four essay questions. You are allowed to prepare/practice on these exam questions one week in advance, and you come on the day of the exam to write them. What's so hard about this? People expecting University to be a cake walk?

Boring topic, boring course. Relatively straightforward. Prof & TA were approachable enough, but very blunt. Not exactly a fun course, but definitely one where success is possible without too much effort.

Loved her & the TA. Expects you to be relatively self-sufficient by this time- won't hand hold!  She's super smart & passionate. Also funny! Final exam was three essay questions given a week in advance. Very easy in 2 hours. One paper, 3500 words, one presentation, one short article critique. No textbook. Really want to take another class with her.
Crim 355-This course is easy- just put time into the paper but easy A if you study.

Lectures posted online! Don't need to attend class ! no textbook.. Final exam Garbage!! 2 hours to write 3 essay questions?!!? are u kidding me? no point form, startin to feel like an english class!! gimme a break!! Avoid going to lectures, so dry and boring!!

Boring lectures!! Don't need to attend any lectures!! Recorded lectures posted up along with powerpoint slides!! midterm was a 40% take home paper.. final was 3 exam topics she gives you a week before to prepare for! I don't think the final exam was fair!  Have to prepare for all 3 exams She wants all answers in essay format, no point form! Bad!!!
1 mt, 1 essay, 1 final. Mt was kinda difficult, final was ridiculously easy. Dr. Bell doesn't give very much direction but the class was fairly easy.

I must say, I found the prof to be the opposite of all the reviews on her so far.  She was a good professor, that new the material and was always able to help.  She made the class easy and an instant A.  I am taking the next forensics with her.
I didn't think it was possible but she managed to make forensic sciences boring.  She's smart but she's a horrible speaker and not engaging at all.
Not an engaging public speaker. Lectures were unnecessary, as was the textbook. I rarely showed up for class, and put almost no effort into the papers, still managed to get a B+.

Good class, ridiculously easy workload. Do not buy textbook, its like 250$ and not required. And if for some reason you need it for a reference or something its in the library. Other than that you won't crack it. Dr. Bell is a well spoken teacher and pretty easy marker.

she talks, you listen - do not dare interrupt, do not dare ask questions, do not dare to contradict her. If you can do that its an easy A, just forget most of what you learned because somehow despite having a textbook, she got it wrong.

Interesting but hard course. Do not take classes with this prof if you are expecting an easy course. You have to earn that A. She expects that upper level students can think for themselves and does not baby people. She will help out on assignments but wont do them for you.

She is downright scary and intimidating! On the first class, she scared off all non-arch major students basically by telling them that they simply won't make it in her class. By the second class, there were only about 15 people left with an original class size of about 30. Very unapproachable and patronizing when I asked for help.

i as well was disappointed to see lynne instead of gail and the entomology lecture proved me (and several of us) right. she was boring and unorganized with the lecture slides. she also tried to apply her british humour into her lectures. only positive part of this course was TA's and easy marking scheme (so far)

it was an easy class but the prof made it so uninteresting.. with her thousands of "um...", her lecture made me fall asleep all the time.. very bad prof... never take a class with her... her notes, very very unorganized...

I was SOOO disappointed when I came on day 1 and saw Lynn instead of Gail Anderson. And my disappointment was continued when Lynn started the lecture. She was so disorganized and unhelpful in lecture. She posts slides online but then ignores the order and won't let us copy new slides saying we should listen to her incoherent ramble instead.

Lynne demands that you put your best effort into your work, she gives respect when respect is earned. She is a fair marker and I found her to be a great help to me. I would recommend this teacher to a serious student, not one interested in just getting an easy mark.
She's awsome, you've just got to work hard and prove yourself to her.  She makes you push yourself.

Lynne is great- an old-school prof, she's fairly strict and demands respect. Students here are just too used to being babied; by 3rd and 4th year you should expect to think for yourself and work for your grade. And come on, we knew every question on the final in advance! I've got to admit that she is intimidating though
No Comments

I will NEVER take a class from her again. Poorly organized and very unaccessable. She wasn't around for 1/2 the term and the guest lecturers were more willing to help me than she was. She became very upset when I asked her to clarify what she wanted for the paper worth 60%. Very intelligent but a horrible teacher.

She's SCARY...no warm and fuzzy here people...The class was so disorganized, we never knew what to read, and she wouldn't tell us.  70% of the grade was the paper which she never talked about and 30% a power point.  She's obviously a smart woman, but doesn't mean she should be teaching!  I won't be taking anymore classes with her!

Fun class,great guest lectures. bad marking scheme. 60%  term paper, the format of which kept changing , and 40% for a seen final exam. Prof not very accessible,prone to kicking students out of office or slamming door in face , knows her stuff though and utterly brilliant; good lecturer bad teacher.
No Comments
